paper_abstract: This article presents a dual-band concurrent fully-integrated low-noise amplifier (LNA) targeted to WLAN IEEE 802.11a/b/g standards. The use of a concurrent topology enables saving die area and power consumption compared with the parallel solution that employs two separated LNAs. An original design methodology that helps in the selection of input/output matching network element values is also presented. The LNA die area is 1.0 x 0.9 mm(2) and it consumes 9 mW (5 MA at 1.8 V). (C) 2008 Wiley Periodicals. Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAW 19; 1-13, 2009.
paper_title: Design and Implementation of a Dual-Band Concurrent Fully-integrated LNA for WLAN IEEE 802.11a/b/g Applications
